definition: forced labor/corvée/obligatory task/military service/to use as servant/to enserf/servant (old)/war/campaign/battle

sentences.english: Dozens of servants scurried through the large foyer.
sentences.chinese: 许多仆役在偌大的门厅中快速地穿梭着。

sentences.english: Although the husband of princess personality is extremely respectable, in fact whatsoever fashion together the servant is common.
sentences.chinese: 驸马身份虽然尊贵，其实不过形同仆役一般。

sentences.english: Look at that." A servant had just come in with the morning mail, a great mass of letters and magazines.
sentences.chinese: 一个仆役刚送来了早班邮件，一大抱信件和杂志。

sentences.english: The indentured servants?work conditions and duration of service also depended on location.
sentences.chinese: 契约仆役的工作条件与服役期限也依地区而不同。

sentences.english: Money is a good servant, but a bad master.
sentences.chinese: 金钱是好的仆役，坏的主人。

sentences.english: A servant had just come in with the morning mail, a great mass of letters and magazines.
sentences.chinese: 一个仆役刚送来了早班邮件，一大抱信件和杂志。

sentences.english: Why should such a well - educated man settle for being a butler?
sentences.chinese: 为什么受过这样好教育的人竟甘为仆役长？

sentences.english: He that is the greatest among you shall be your servant.
sentences.chinese: 你们中那最大的，该作你们的仆役。

sentences.english: By their service, and their servants, shall ye know them.
sentences.chinese: 通过宫里的服务，以及他们的仆役，你就能了解他们。

sentences.english: Mfirsty is a bad servant, but a bad master.
He makes winds his messengers, flames of fire his servants.
sentences.chinese: 以风为使者，以火焰为仆役。

sentences.english: Suddenly, he heard his servant whistling.
sentences.chinese: 突然，他听到他的仆役吹起了口哨。

sentences.english: He could see her meeting the boy at the door and smiling sardonically .
sentences.chinese: 他可以想象得到她怎么脸带讥笑在门口接待仆役。

definition: (old) servant hired to keep guard, run errands etc
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
forced labor of feudal tenant (corvée)/bailiff of feudal yamen
